title: Boy, 5, grazed by bullet in 'strange' Muskegon Heights shooting
content:
MUSKEGON HEIGHTS, MI -- A 5-year-old child was grazed by a bullet Saturday in Muskegon Heights, in an incident the police chief is calling "strange."
The boy apparently was grazed in the buttock by a bullet while getting out of his father's truck, said Muskegon Heights Police Department Chief Joseph E. Thomas Jr. The child suffered non-life threatening injuries and was taken to a hospital, treated and released.
Thomas said the boy and his father, who are from Texas, were attending a birthday party in the 2500 block of Reynolds Street. He was wounded at around 9:45 p.m.
Thomas said it is unclear where the shot came from. He said dispatch received no calls from the area about shots fired or gunshots being heard.
"This is a very unusual set of circumstances," Thomas said.
The investigation is ongoing.
